oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Power--bandwidth limitations of an optical resonance
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Miller, Owen D.
Hsu, Chia Wei
Anquillare, Emma
Joannopoulos, John D.
Soljačić, Marin
Johnson, Steven G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Physics - Optics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present shape-independent upper limits to the power--bandwidth product for a single resonance in an optical scatterer, with the bound depending only on the material susceptibility. We show that quasistatic metallic scatterers can nearly reach the limits, and we apply our approach to the problem of designing $N$ independent, subwavelength scatterers to achieve flat, broadband response even if they individually exhibit narrow resonant peaks.
